news.title: Fed's Powell cautions about higher long-term rates as 'supply shocks' provide policy challenges
news.summary: Powell said longer-term interest rates are likely to be higher as the economy changes and policy is in flux. Powell said Thursday that longer-than-expected interest rates will likely be higher.

news.title: Dick's Sporting Goods to acquire Foot Locker for $2.4 billion in effort to corner Nike market
news.summary: The combined company will have a competitive edge in the Nike sneaker market. It will provide Dick's access to international markets, plus a younger consumer.

news.title: Coinbase says hackers bribed staff to steal customer data and are demanding $20 million ransom
news.summary: Coinbase may cost up to $400 million to fix, the company estimated. The incident may cost the company up to £300 million to £400 million, it said.

news.title: Trump says he doesn't want Apple building products in India: 'I had a little problem with Tim Cook'
news.summary: Apple has been ramping up production in India with the aim of making around 25% of global iPhones in the country in the next few years.

news.title: Walmart CFO says price hikes from tariffs could start later this month, as retailer beats on earnings
news.summary: Walmart's CFO says price increases from President Donald Trump's tariffs could start soon. Walmart beat first-quarter earnings expectations but missed on revenue.

news.title: Trump’s tax bill is Republicans’ big, bloated, $4 trillion headache
news.summary: GOP lawmakers prioritize politics over economic growth. GOP lawmakers prioritise politics over growth. Republicans say they want to focus on jobs, not the economy.

news.title: ‘I’m flabbergasted’: My friend wants to borrow $5,800 to save his home from foreclosure. What should I do?
news.summary: “I previously loaned a friend $7,000, and she later died,” he said. “I’m not going to let her die.”

news.title: I have $50,000 in credit-card debt after my divorce, but received $30,000 after a car wreck. Do I buy a used Lexus?
news.summary: “I previously drove a fully loaded BMW X7, and driving a used Lexus feels like a big drop,” he says.

news.title: Walmart concedes ‘magnitude of tariffs’ is pushing prices up after strong first quarter
news.summary: Walmart CEO Doug McMillon described the company’s immediate challenge as navigating the impact of tariffs in the U.S. McMillon: “We’re going to have to be very, very careful.”

news.title: The retail buy-the-dip move paid off. What that crowd of investors is doing now, according to JPMorgan.
news.summary: JPMorgan says retail investors did well with a buy-the-dip strategy last month. But that crowd of investors is getting weary.
